place.name: GROVE
place.gazetteerText: GROVE, a parish in the district of Leighton Buzzard and county of Buckingham; contiguous to Bedfordshire, and on the north-western railway, 2 miles S of LeightonBuzzard. Post town, Leighton Buzzard. Acres, 210. Real property, £708. Pop., 19. house, 4. The property is divided among a few. The living is a rectory in the diocese of Oxford. Value, £73. Patron, Lord Overstone. The church is good. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
